title: Tighter skill index for faster agent parsing
story: As an LLM agent, I want the SKILL_INDEX section to use a compact single-line format with one instruction banner so that I spend less of my context window on structural overhead and more on the actual conversation.
acceptance_criteria: Instruction banner appears exactly once at the top of SKILL_INDEX
Each skill is a single line with ID, name, description, and path
All skill information from the verbose format is preserved

title: Lean persona content in session cache
story: As the SDLC orchestrator, I want the ROUNDTABLE_CONTEXT persona content to contain only voice-critical sections so that the session cache is smaller without losing the persona information needed for roundtable analysis dispatch.
acceptance_criteria: Persona content retains Identity, Principles, Voice Integrity, Interaction Style
Sections redundant with roundtable lead system prompt are stripped
Persona heading delimiters are preserved for extraction
Self-validation is compacted into a single checklist

title: Lean topic content in session cache
story: As the SDLC orchestrator, I want topic file metadata (YAML frontmatter, depth guidance, source step files) stripped from the cached content so that only the analytical knowledge and validation criteria consume context budget.
acceptance_criteria: Topic content has no YAML frontmatter
Topic content has no depth_guidance or source_step_files
Analytical Knowledge, Validation Criteria, and Artifact Instructions are preserved
Topic heading delimiters are preserved for extraction

title: Condensed discovery context
story: As an LLM agent, I want the DISCOVERY_CONTEXT section to preserve all tables and key metrics while removing redundant prose so that I get the same project knowledge in fewer tokens.
acceptance_criteria: All tables (architecture, tech stack, test health) are preserved verbatim
Prose that restates table content is removed or condensed
Section is reduced by at least 20%

title: Safe tightening with fail-open fallback
story: As a framework developer, I want each tightening function to fail open to verbose content so that a bug in tightening never breaks the session cache or causes empty sections.
acceptance_criteria: Each tightening function returns original content on any error
A failed tightening does not prevent other sections from being tightened
Verbose mode logs a warning on fallback

title: Reduction reporting in verbose mode
story: As a framework developer, I want to see per-section character savings when rebuilding the cache in verbose mode so that I can verify the tightening is achieving the target reduction.
acceptance_criteria: Verbose mode shows per-section before/after/reduction stats
Verbose mode shows total markdown reduction summary
Stats are written to stderr
